title: How to Make a Tree Trunk Lamp

steps.headline: Find your fallen tree.
steps.description: Look specifically for a trunk or branch that will match and fit on top of your side table.

steps.headline: Grab a hand saw.
steps.description: Cut a piece from the tree.

steps.headline: Cut the branch about 6 to 8 inches (15.2 to 20.3 cm), depending on your preference.
Mark the center of the trunk/branch with a pencil.
steps.description: This is where you will make a hole to insert the parts of the broken lampshade.

steps.headline: Grab your drill and make the hole up the bottom.
Get a sandpaper and start sanding the top of the trunk.
Get you old or broken lamp and lampshade.
Take the lamp apart.
steps.description:
Retain the inner parts of the lampshade. Usually its just a metal rod with the wiring leading to the bulb. steps.headline: Clean the trunk (the body of your lamp).
Insert the metal rod part of your broken lamp.
steps.description: Make sure the wiring goes out on the base of the trunk.

steps.headline: Use a hammer and chisel to make a wire insert.
steps.description: This will make the base stable and hide the wiring well.

steps.headline: Secure the bulb socket well on top of the trunk.
Put a low watt bulb on the socket.
Place it on your side table and turn it on.
steps.description: See how it lights up your home!

text:
Find your fallen tree. Look specifically for a trunk or branch that will match and fit on top of your side table. Grab a hand saw. Cut a piece from the tree. Cut the branch about 6 to 8 inches (15.2 to 20.3 cm), depending on your preference. Mark the center of the trunk/branch with a pencil. This is where you will make a hole to insert the parts of the broken lampshade. Grab your drill and make the hole up the bottom. Get a sandpaper and start sanding the top of the trunk. Get you old or broken lamp and lampshade. Take the lamp apart. Retain the inner parts of the lampshade. Usually its just a metal rod with the wiring leading to the bulb. Save the power switch as well. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/43\/Make-Tree-Trunk-Lamp-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Tree-Trunk-Lamp-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/43\/Make-Tree-Trunk-Lamp-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Tree-Trunk-Lamp-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Clean the trunk (the body of your lamp). Insert the metal rod part of your broken lamp. Make sure the wiring goes out on the base of the trunk. Use a hammer and chisel to make a wire insert. This will make the base stable and hide the wiring well. Secure the bulb socket well on top of the trunk. Put a low watt bulb on the socket. Place the shade on top. Place it on your side table and turn it on. See how it lights up your home!
